result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C Skinner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
The Court Orders: It is hereby ordered and adjudged that as to count 1 the Defendant is ordered to serve 0 months 30 days of jail time as a condition of probation.
Proposed Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Dated 07/05/2022, Letter from Agent Stephanie Duncan to Court requesting to impose jail time as a condition of probation.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachments
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(10:31 AM cases 21TR5417, 21CM519, 21CM892, 22CF147, 22CF254, 22CF312, 22CF438 called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael C Skinner in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Michael C Skinner.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF147 and Court accepts waiver.
State will file an Information which will mirror the complaint in 22CF147. Attorney Thorson has no objection to proceeding without the Information filed but understands it will be filed to mirror the complaint.
Prior offense acknowledged for 21CM519.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CM519 Count 2: OWI 2nd Offense, 21CM892 Count 1: Disorderly Conduct, 22CF147 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine and 22CF312 Count 3: Misdemeanor Battery.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CM519 Count 2, 21CM892 Count 1, 22CF147 Count 1 and 22CF312 Count 3.
Attorney Thorson requests the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court orders sentences as follows:
21CM519 Count 2: Fine/Forfeiture of $1,429.00 plus court costs. 10 days jail with 10 days credit. 12 month driver's license revocation. 12 month ignition interlock device. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Any remaining charges including cases 21TR5417, 21TR5418 are dismissed and read in. Parties note case 21TR5417 is dismissed as it is now incorporated in case 21CM519.

21CM892 Count 1: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

22CF312 Count 3: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

22CF147 Count 1: Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. AODA and follow through with recommendations. 90 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any contraband seized is ordered destroyed. 33 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 22CF254, 22CF438 are dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
